cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 204 (Tuesday, December 12, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOYLAN:H.R. 6729.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Pursuant to Article one of the United States ConstitutionCongress has the power to enact this legislation.The single subject of this legislation is:To permit the use of NATO and major non-NATO ally dredgeships in the United States.[Page H6860]

item.title: Allied Partnership and Port Modernization Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

bill.title: Allied Partnership and Port Modernization Act

item.title: Allied Partnership and Port Modernization Act
Allied Partnership and Port Modernization Act
To permit the use of NATO and major non-NATO ally dredge ships in the United States.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
